title: Vel'Koz Q
body:
So why does Vel'Koz Q not have an indicator, but Zac E has to have an indicator now?

Legitimately confusing as to why Vel'koz's Q had the indicator removed when a bunch of other abilities have indicators, and most indicators are changed to make them MORE visible and not less.

replies.body:
The only thing I can think of, is that Unlike Zac, Vel'Koz can re-activate the ability to seperate the particle early, meaning that the indicator is not ALWAYS where the ability will break up. And that could get confusing for people who don't play against Vel much.

I suppose it works a bit like Graves's ult, it fires in a line, but spreads out at the end (just like Vel's one), and Graves's ult doesn't have an indicator. 

Where Zac's one is very similar to Aatrox's Q, which does have an indicator. 
That is my speculation.

Very few non-charged skillshots have range indicators, which would made Vel's Q the weird exception, until it was taken away.
velkoz q is a lot easier to dodge
Which has 0 to do with the issue.

because unlike fizz e and hecarim w and zac e, the animation clearly follows the path of the damage, while zac e and etc he player couldn't accurately determine the damage zones. Plus, if vel q had an indicator, it would literally be impossible to hit anything other than a complete retard as the delays on the spells motion are so long as it is.

Because you dont get hit by a velkoz Q from the other side of the map out of fog of war, it doesnt knock you up and is way less impactful than getting hit by a zac jump. its also much more predictable i mean its a line you know its gonna be splitting from the original skillshot line. also it landing does not gaurentee the rest of velkoz abilities are going to land like zacs ability sets him up for. sure it slows and helps him hit the rest but its not a gaurentee

hope this answered the question for you=)
